title: Plat for 3 seasons - Can't get out of silver this season
body:
I used to rag on people for saying they were in elo hell. But damn, I finally see exactly what they mean now. 

If you don't play champs on the approved hyper carry list, it really is impossible to climb. You just can't impact the game enough to carry. Even if you shut down someone strong (karthus vs yasuo for example), he will still come back and just dominate no matter how hard he failed in the beginning. Meanwhile it doesn't matter how fed you get on non-hyper champs, you just chances of winning will always remain 50/50 based entirely on how many hyper carries your team has vs the enemies.

Sorry to all of you that I discredited in the past, elo hell really does exist.

Edit:

For reference, I play mid mages such as Xerath, Vel'koz, and Viktor

There's 3 ways to be good at the game.

1. You're legitimately good at the game and understand the mechanics and inner workings.

2. You know what to expect from the enemy and know how to outplay it.

3. You cheese your opponent and out-mechanic him.

If you actually know how to play the game, you should never have issues with climbing up to D5 MMR... unless you knowingly forego common sense because, "lul it's just silvers." and then it's your fault for underestimating them. They're not mentally handicapped they just aren't efficient players.

If you know what to expect and how to outplay it, good fucking luck. Again, they're not efficient players so everything you know about jungle pathing, throw it out the window. Just punish punish punish bad overextensions and force pressure into your lane while minimizing deaths. 

If you cheese and out-mechanic your opponent... well I don't assume you do since you play easily outplayed, immobile mages.

So you're either intentionally playing bad because you think low elos are subhuman or you're expecting them to play the game at a plat level and you're left both confused and frustrated. Neither are inherently the fault of elo hell, they're your fault.
You really have no clue what you are talking about.

I'd like to comment on your last point, since I agree with everything else you said. I'm in Plat 5 at the moment.

That's the problem nowadays. You don't know what to expect. You can be facing a silver 2 player who is legit bad and crush them, or they can actually be decent and just not play a lot of games to climb higher. You can't know how to adjust your playstyle to gain advantages over them. Since League is a race, you have to be quick and fast with what you need to do. I will give you an example.

Let's assume I am a mid laner and I play against a silver 2  player. Let's say that I can easily beat them, even though I don't know that yet. If my bottom lane feeds, what do I do? I have to try and keep up the tempo and try to gain similar advantages in my lane. But I can't always do that, because I don't know to which extent my enemy mid laner is bad. Therefore, if they aren't as bad as my bottom lane, I can't possible gain enough adv to battle the enemies. At the same time, what if my enemy mid laner isn't that bad of a player and I can't get a lot out of them? 

This example leads me to be doing risky plays sometimes in order to try and stay ahead of the race, ahead of the curve to try and always have the upper hand over the enemies. The problem is that I can't always identify the risk/reward because I don't know what kind of enemy I'm facing. Sure, I can op.gg their division, I can even check KDAs, cs/min, that's good and all, but that still doesn't mean much. I can play against a silver 2 guy and be able to hard cheese them and all my risks paying off, and then having a comfortable lead and possible win OR I can play against another silver 2 guy, who won't fall for my tricks, my risks might even lead to me dying, and then what happens if my team also feeds?

That's the problem I've had recently when I tried to climb above Plat 5. I don't know how to min/max risk/reward. You can tell me that I can play risk-free, do the basics, laning pressure, wave control, good warding etc. but when it comes to outpacing your opponent, sometimes, the slow and steady risk-free beatdown on my enemy mid laner is just not good enough, when my bottom lane loses first tower in 7 minutes.

If you notice a hard snowball/shove in the bottom lane, I would advise you to try roaming more, it won't always work but you could definitely give it a shot, plus coordinating with a jungle gank is always nice :)

Sorry for the late reply. All this theorycrafting is good, and I'm all for it, but what happens when my jungler is boosted and doesn't wanna comply? Also, what happens when I play someone like Viktor in the mid lane, who isn't the best at roaming, like a Zed or a Talon is? Essentially, I am getting forced to play things with a lot of mobility and damage early to try and help my losing lanes, before even knowing if I will have one.

May invest in some move speed runes? Viktor is using Klepto currently you could do that, or domination secondaries with ooc movespeed? Theres really no panacea to poor teamwork sometimes us commoners just have to eat the punishment of rough games lol

You could also try your control mages as support in the bot lane as well? You won't be able to get as fast income but you'll control more variables such as vision and roaming to mid and possibly even impacting their jungler as well, just a thought.

Well, I finished playing a lot of flex games in mid-Gold elo. I played like 12 games of ADC, 9 of them as Sivir. Won all as Sivir, and did like 2/3 as Cait. In some games, team was doing fine, in others, team was doing poorly. What I got out of all of those games, esepcially the Sivir ones, is that I always had agency over the game. My lane was a safe farming lane, with good opportunities to trade some damage. After I got my Stormrazor, it just felt the game was over. I had all the options to keep the game stalled out if we were losing and then just pump out insane damage to carry fights later.

Sivir is my #1 pick at the moment, honestly. Not even Viktor can match her waveclear and agency she has over the game. I feel like I'm 1 division bracket higher when I play this empowering champion. I managed to have an average of 9.5 cs/minute over 9 games, while always outdamaging anyone else.

For a champion that is supposed to be in the bottom lane and supposed to be scaling later in the game, it feels like I can impact the game so much faster by just taking bottom tower by perma shoving the lane, while also being safe (bot is safer than mid), and then I'm able to rotate around and snowball leads or balance the game if we're losing. I'm not saying that every champion should be able to do this, but especially Viktor who can't really fight early (apart from this Q max bs), he should be able to at least control a lane without having to worry getting all-ined or going oom.

I'm replying now because I was waiting for the 8.22 changes to go through. It seems like they fucked up Viktor even harder. Now, his early game is hit once again, because of this Q max bullshit, and now has to wait until he gets his fourth item in order to get the same damage he had before. Traditional AP mid Viktor might as well be dead as fuck now. His Q trading tool at levels 9-13 feels dead, his R might feel even more lackluster.

They could have instead have his Q cooldown scale with levels, rather than Q ranks, or his shield being based on more AP and less mana. Or maybe they could have the slow zone of Iceborn Gauntlet being less potent from ranged champions. Or they could buff Rylai's slow, so that there is more incentive to get it.

I guess it's the end of the season and we should see more changes once preseason goes through, but it feels like Riot doesn't understand what's going on. It reminds me of tank Ekko top back in season 6 (?). They reduced his base damages and increased his AP ratios to remove the tank Ekko thing. The thing is, AP Ekko was always viable throughout this whole time. Right now, AP Viktor is not really viable, when he can get destroyed by most mid laners, especially things like Akali, Irelia etc. Again, Riot could hit the Q shield's mana scaling and have it have more AP scaling. 

Anyway, I don't wanna bore you anymore with these. I have so many things I can say, but I guess I'll have to settle for the moment and wait for preseason to see what's up. Maybe I'll be lucky enough to comment around here when that time comes and have a conversation with you again once it happens.

Honestly man, if you could find synergy with a support you could take both our strategies and put them together, hard shove their bot lane and make a dash towards mid with a support that works well with sivir (pyke may do well considering his stealth) or you could disrupt the jungle and take their farm, harass them out of your side or just continue to shove your lane, I guess it depends on the team/matchup right? Just some extra ideas that may help you move towards plat/diamond, congrats on mid gold

if you decide, "huh, that guy isn't playing well but my team is feeding I need to do something risky to carry." you'd fall under the category of, "knows better but throws anyway." You pop a 30 cs lead on most champions you can roam on them and use those for your kills. Telling yourself you have to hurry up and make a play, especially if you don't know how to min/max and look for the best opportunities, will only lead to risky stuff you normally wouldn't do because you aren't feeling the strain of a stacked game.

In silver all you have to do is kill the hypercarry with ~~your kit~~ your Q + duskblade stormrazor passive electrocute triforce autoattack dealing 500% of their max HP, suicide and it doesn't matter because their team is now panicking and it's free kills.

I used to think elo hell didn't exist, until this season I reached the point where I was winning lane 90% of the time on Fiora (not exagerating, I have the numbers to back it up), all my individual performance metrics (cs, KDA, etc) were good and I was losing MMR rather than climbing. 

Now I win my lane around 95% of the time and I am finally starting to climb.

Basically, laning at a low-mid plat level was literally not enough to carry in gold 5, I had to improve even more to the point where I'm likely laning like a high plat (maybe even D5).

Very few people would believe that I am laning at that level in Gold 5, unless they saw that I average a 1200 gold lead over my lane opponent as Fiora and I've been platinum several times before.
